citation.article-title: Kaistia geumhonensis sp. nov. and Kaistia dalseonensis sp. nov., two members of the class Alphaproteobacteria
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Kaistia geumhonensis sp. nov.
Kaistia geumhonensis (geum.ho.nen′sis. N.L. fem. adj. geumhonensis pertaining to the Geumho River, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, non-motile short rods and cocci, varying in size between 0.6 and 1.0 µm long.
Colonies on R2A are round with a greasy surface and cream in colour.
Good growth is observed on R2A agar at 28–32 °C.
Growth occurs at 18–37 °C but not at 10 or 42 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is pH 7–8; growth occurs at pH 6–9 but not at pH 5 or 10.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–2 % (w/v) NaCl.
Does not hydrolyse casein, chitin, DNA, starch, HE-cellulose or xylan.

Positive for urease, aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase activities but negative for nitrate and nitrite reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase activity and gelatin hydrolysis (API 20 NE test strip).

Assimilates N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, l-fucose, d-glucose, inositol, d-maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, malic acid, d-melibiose, potassium 2-ketogluconate, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, d-sucrose and d-sorbitol but does not assimilate potassium adipic acid, l-alanine, capric acid, gluconate, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid, 3-hydroxybutyric acid, itaconic acid, lactic acid, phenylacetic acid, potassium 5-ketogluconate, l-proline, propionic acid, l-serine, sodium acetate, sodium malonate, suberic acid, trisodium citrate or valeric acid (API 20 NE and API ID 32GN test strips).

Positive for (API ZYM test strip): N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), β-galactosidase and α- and β-glucosidase activities but negative for alkaline phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, leucine arylamidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin and valine arylamidase activities.

Acid is produced from aesculin, d- and l-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, d-fucose, gentiobiose, d-lyxose, maltose, mannitol, melezitose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-xylose, raffinose, rhamnose, sucrose, trehalose, d-turanose, xylitol and l-xylose and is produced weakly from adonitol, dulcitol, fructose, l-fucose, galactose, glucose, inositol, lactose, mannose, melibiose, methyl α-d-mannoside, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sorbose, d-tagatose and d-xylose, but is not produced from N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, d- or l-arabitol, erythritol, gluconate, glycerol, glycogen, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate or starch.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c and C19 : 0ω8c cyclo.
The type strain, B1-1T ( = KCTC 12849T = DSM 18799T), was isolated from the Geumho River in Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.6 mol% (determined by HPLC).
